com.percussion.util
Class PSURLEncoder

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.util.PSURLEncoder

public class PSURLEncoder
extends Object

The PSURLEncoder class is a utility class which supports encoding URLs. The process of encoding URLs involves take special characters and converting them to an escaped representation. The escape syntax is %HH where HH is the hex representation of the byte. This even supports unicode as the unicode character may end up being two or three escaped chars. The special characters are:

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis

Method Detail

encodePath

public static String encodePath(String data)
URL-8 encodes the given string, which should be in the part of the URL after the server:port and before the "?" that starts the query. Note that forward slashes (/) will not be escaped, but other characters which are not allowed in a URI will be escaped, including colons (:), question marks (?), ampersands (&), etc.

It replaces space character (' ') to its hex representation ("%20").

Parameters:
data - The string to be encoded
Returns:
The encoded string, with all reserved characters escaped. Unreserved characters will not be escaped.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the provided string is null.

encodeQuery

public static String encodeQuery(String data)
URL-8 encodes the given string, which should be in the part of the URL after the "?" that starts the query. Note that any ampersands (&) and questions marks (?) will be not be encoded.

It replaces space character (' ') to plus character ('+').

Parameters:
data - The string to be encoded
Returns:
The encoded string, with all reserved characters escaped. Unreserved characters will not be escaped.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the provided string is null.
